ygData.subject: Re: [RE: [eqbards] Need assistance please  ]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Evulia, Yes from what I can tell, there will be judges that tell you what your next move will be and which opponent you are dueling next. At least I sure
ygData.messageBody:
Hi Evulia,

Yes from what I can tell, there will be judges that tell you what your next
move will be and which opponent you are dueling next. At least I sure hope so!
We are playing good against evil and the highest level character is the king.
The king for the good is lvl 46 and the king for the evil is lvl 48. The
queens are lvl's 41 mag/33 necro respectively. It should interesting
especially considering the player that is the 33 necro is a trip! He is SO
funny!! I'm lined up to fight a lvl 15 mag. Hmmmm....

I'm going to be honest I haven't used Chords of Dissonance to much since I
kept forgetting that I still had it "active" when I went around the guards. I
kept ending up looking at the sky, deader than a doornail. But I'll experiment
with it in the next couple of days. My instruments are maxed out on practices
right now though so that's good.

Talk to ya later!

Melodii

"Webber, Jessica" <webber@...> wrote:

> Never dueled, so I can't really be of much assistance, sorry. I'm curious
> though, does this mean there will be two "players" one of which will tell
> you which of the opposite team to attack? Also, which get's played by a
> higher level character? The king or the queen?
>
> How much damage can you do at level 11 with Chords of Dissonance? I have
> yet to use it with an instrument. Maybe you could kite a melee class with
it
> or keep a caster interupted.
>
> Good luck
> Evulia, bard of 10 songs, Tunare
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Lisa [mailto:Lilyanatwin@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 10:14 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Need assistance please
> >
> >
> > Hi fellow bards!
> >
> > I need some information assistance. We are having an event on
> > my server,
> > Karana, on Saturday. We are having a chessmatch at the
> > chessboard with duels.
> > Different level players have been chosen for the role's of
> > King, Queen,
> > Bishop, Rooks and Pawns. I volunteered to be there because my
> > guild has a
> > major role in the event. I am a Level 11 bard. I figured I
> > would be asked to
> > assist in the organization of the event. However, I have been
> > chosen as a
> > PAWN! Could anyone advise me on the best strategy to employ
> > to possibly come
> > out of this alive? I know I am probably being vague as to
> > some of the rules of
> > the game but that is because they are still being determined.
> > I do know that
> > charming will not be allowed. Only self-buffs will be
> > allowed. DOT's are
> > allowed.
> >
> > I am still in the process of figuring out how to be the best
> > bard that I can
> > be and I have a lot to learn. So I look to each of
> > you......the experts!
> >
> > Thanks in advance for any assistance you could give me!
> >
> > Melodii (Bard of 11 seasons)
> >
> >
> >
